page.title: 17ARKWRIGHT COLLIERY
page.content: Our pit is called a drift mine.The men go underground in little trains. 540 people work at the pit in three shifts.Days 6am to 2:30pm.Afters 12 noon to 8:30pm and nights 10pm to 6:30 am.The seams go along underground for about a mile.When the pit closes,in about 4 years,we would like the land to be used for a leisure centre or something like that. FARM LAND The colliery and the village are surrounded by farm land.Most of the land belongs to 2 farmers.They both keep beef cattle.They also grow the straw and corn needed for their animals.Mr Elliot has a farm shop where he sells meat.
